alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Rutland and central Windsor Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Reading, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodstock, Hartland Four Corners, Windsor, Ludlow, Cavendish, Shrewsbury, Ludlow Village, Plymouth, Hartland, Reading, West Windsor, Bridgewater, Mount Holly, Weathersfield, Plymouth Union, Felchville, Brownsville, West Woodstock, Hammondsville and Tyson. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 57 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Windsor
